intro: Emmotum conjunctum, commonly known as the clustered emmotum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces delicate, often fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Emmotum conjunctum is considered a species of conservation concern.
